metadata.subject: TERP Cannabis ERP System - Feature Review and Requirements Gathering

items.title: Dashboard - Available Money Display
evidence: how much money I have available right now
This is how much I have in available money. This is how much money I actually have, but there's this number is available, which is after payable scheduled
items.meaning: Dashboard should show available cash (total minus scheduled payables)
items.acceptance_criteria: Dashboard displays: (1) Total cash on hand, (2) Scheduled payables, (3) Available cash after payables

items.title: Dashboard - Multi-Location Cash Tracking
evidence: I have two locations with cash. I have what Z has and what I have
items.meaning: Need to track cash across multiple locations/people (Z and Doc)
items.acceptance_criteria: Dashboard shows cash by location/person with ability to see individual and combined totals

items.title: Z's Cash Audit Tracking
evidence: I kept my audit tipping off every fucking week and it's driving me crazy

It could be a mistake in a lot of places. It could be a mistake in money coming in...It could be a mistake in payments where we copy that and then you paste it down here. Sometimes it gets, it pastes over somebody else's payment
items.meaning: Current audit system has multiple error points causing weekly discrepancies. New simple in/out tracking for Z's cash is working better.
items.acceptance_criteria: Audit tracking system with: (1) Simple in/out ledger per person, (2) Weekly reset capability, (3) Starting balance tracking, (4) No copy/paste errors possible

items.title: Dashboard - Shift Payment Tracking
evidence: We have how much we've paid in the shift. We reset this every shift change. So on my shift, we did 2.7
items.meaning: Track payments made during each shift with reset capability
items.acceptance_criteria: Dashboard shows payments made in current shift with ability to reset at shift change

items.title: Payables Due When SKU Hits Zero
evidence: When it hits zero, it becomes due. When the inventory hits zero
When a specific skew hits zero
Somebody has 10 things, five of them are at zero. Those five are due now
items.meaning: Payables become due when specific SKU inventory reaches zero, not when entire batch is sold
items.acceptance_criteria: System automatically flags payables as due when associated SKU inventory reaches zero

items.title: Office Owned Inventory Tracking
evidence: office owned, which is useful just to make sure that you're not buying too much weed
it's just a non-consignment, basically. That I've cashed out. Any cashed out inventory that's still live
items.meaning: Track non-consignment inventory that has been paid for but not yet sold
items.acceptance_criteria: Dashboard shows total office-owned (non-consignment) inventory value

items.title: Clients as Both Buyers and Suppliers
evidence: Do you have many clients that are buyers and suppliers? Yes
I have probably half a dozen
items.meaning: System must support clients who are both buyers and suppliers with unified tab
items.acceptance_criteria: Client can be flagged as buyer, supplier, or both with unified ledger view

items.title: Complex Tab for Jesse (Buyer/Supplier)
evidence: Me mostly being my buddy, Jesse, where his tab is the most annoying
we credit his tab for shipping. We credit his tab for products. We credit his tab for flowers that he's brought in
it's kind of a lot of in and out
items.meaning: Jesse's tab has credits for shipping, products, flowers brought in, and debits for purchases - needs unified tracking
items.acceptance_criteria: Single ledger view showing all credits (shipping, products, consignment) and debits (purchases, payments) for complex clients

items.title: Billing for Services (Shipping, Consulting)
evidence: I'm not sure if I have built in a billing for services in the right way
just some way of being able to create an invoice basically
just credit them 2,700 for consulting on 36 units
items.meaning: Need ability to create service invoices/credits for shipping, consulting, etc.
items.acceptance_criteria: Ability to create service credits/invoices with description and amount that appear on client ledger

items.title: Simple Client Ledger
evidence: I've created what you said, basically, which is just like a super simple ledger
That also tells you how much they owe
This also should tell you how much you owe
items.meaning: Simple ledger showing ins/outs and current balance for each client
items.acceptance_criteria: Client ledger shows: (1) All transactions in/out, (2) Running balance, (3) What they owe / what you owe them

items.title: New Clients Added Infrequently
evidence: adding clients doesn't happen that often, right?
that's going to happen two or three times a year
items.meaning: New client creation is rare (2-3x/year), doesn't need to be optimized for speed
items.acceptance_criteria: Client creation flow can be thorough rather than fast

items.title: Client Tagging with Referrer
evidence: I tagged him his name and then the person that brought him in
And then you have him in the refer
items.meaning: Clients should be tagged with who referred them
items.acceptance_criteria: Client record includes referrer field that links to another client

items.title: Referrer Lookup Like Phone Contacts
evidence: Mikey brings in four different buyers. I don't remember all their fucking names. I can look up Mikey, and then I can see all the people he brings in
The referred by needs to actually map to whoever the customer is
I need to have a place to scroll to find
items.meaning: Need to look up referrer and see all their referrals, like phone contacts
items.acceptance_criteria: Typing a client name shows them plus all clients they referred; can click referrer to see all their referrals

items.title: Variable Markups Based on Age/Quantity
evidence: markups are generally based upon how long I've had the product, how much of it I have
Very easy to change
you should be able to do it on an order level, too
items.meaning: Markups are variable, change based on product age and quantity, need to be editable at product and order level
items.acceptance_criteria: Markups editable at: (1) Product level, (2) Order level; No fixed markup requirements

items.title: Sales Sheet Creator / List Generator
evidence: Sales Sheet Creator is something that's actually getting fixed
somebody wants you to send them a list
I don't use that as much anymore...we just do so much live sales now
items.meaning: List generator for sending product lists to clients, used less now due to live sales shift
items.acceptance_criteria: Ability to generate and send product lists to clients

items.title: Live Sales Primary Method Now
evidence: we just do so much live sales now
we only do, like, list shops maybe, like, once a week
Just do so much more live shopping in person
Because the margins are so small
items.meaning: Business has shifted to primarily in-person live shopping due to small margins
items.acceptance_criteria: System should optimize for live shopping workflow

items.title: Invoice History for Debt Disputes
evidence: He pays me, and he's like, what did I owe you before I sent you this much in Bitcoin, and what did I owe you after?
I just have to just, like, go back and, like, delete it
items.meaning: Need to show balance before and after payments for client verification
items.acceptance_criteria: Ledger shows running balance with ability to see balance at any point in time

items.title: Transaction Fee Per Client (Default + Override)
evidence: Everybody has different transaction fees
It'd be nice to have, like, a default set per client, and then be able to edit it if you need to on a transaction level
Some people pay all of it, some people pay none of it, some people pay 4%
items.meaning: Transaction fees vary 2-4% per client, need default per client with per-transaction override
items.acceptance_criteria: Client record has default transaction fee %; each payment can override the default

items.title: Crypto Payment Tracking Tab
evidence: I have a tab where, here it is, the crypto tab
These are the dates of the crypto payments from all the different clients
This is what they sent, and this is after 4%
items.meaning: Track crypto payments with date, client, amount sent, amount after fees
items.acceptance_criteria: Crypto payments tracked with: date, client, gross amount, fee %, net amount

items.title: Suggested Buyer Based on Purchase History
evidence: when I get some trop cherries I'm like who the fuck one of these things
it like automatically tags Like who took those products last
the suggested buyer. Yeah, cool. That's really cool
items.meaning: When viewing a product, show which clients have purchased it before
items.acceptance_criteria: Product view shows list of clients who have purchased this product/strain before

items.title: Client Wants/Needs Tracking
evidence: In the wants-and-needs section
Next time you get sour diesels from p4 make sure to let me know
I can write it on this tab, but I'm not necessarily gonna remember
items.meaning: Track what products each client wants to be notified about
items.acceptance_criteria: Client record has wants/needs list; system can match incoming inventory to wants

items.title: Reverse Lookup - Who Has Product Connections
evidence: somebody just asked me for 4,000 sodas. I'm like oh fuck to ask for sodas
It'd be nice for TW to be like oh, I can ask these eight people they always have connections
items.meaning: When looking for a product, show which suppliers/clients have provided it before
items.acceptance_criteria: Product search shows suppliers who have provided this product before

items.title: Batch Tracking for Inventory
evidence: How important is that for you to be is important?
I want to know when I because that person's like hey, how am I doing on my flowers? I need to be able to pull up that client and be like I have this transaction
items.meaning: Track batches of products by vendor to answer 'how am I doing on my flowers' questions
items.acceptance_criteria: Can view all products from a specific vendor intake with current status

items.title: Aging Inventory Visual Indicators
evidence: Red means I've had it for more than two weeks
I need to move this or because it's more of a payment tracking thing both
I made a mistake in buying these lemon beans for 900...Just need to flush these of the loss
items.meaning: Visual indicator (red) for inventory older than 2 weeks to prompt action
items.acceptance_criteria: Inventory items show color coding: green (<1 week), yellow (1-2 weeks), red (>2 weeks)

items.title: Dashboard Quick View of Aging Inventory
evidence: ideally kind of on the dashboard you just have a quick view of like the aging stuff
items.meaning: Dashboard should show aging inventory at a glance
items.acceptance_criteria: Dashboard widget showing count/value of aging inventory (>2 weeks)

items.title: Real-time Price Negotiation with Farmers
evidence: I'm negotiating a price adjustment, you know on the fly
I had to go back and forth and like how do I fit in for $10?
back and forth to the farmer and then changing the prices
items.meaning: During sales, may need to negotiate with farmer to adjust price to make margin work
items.acceptance_criteria: Easy way to adjust farmer price and see impact on margin in real-time

items.title: Vendor vs Brand (Farmer Code) Distinction
evidence: Vendor and brand are two different things at this moment
T12 will bring in a buddy's flower and will list it under T23
So that's the brand still
items.meaning: Vendor = person who drops off; Brand = farmer code (can be different)
items.acceptance_criteria: Product has separate Vendor (who dropped off) and Brand/Farmer Code fields

items.title: Brands Changed to Farmer Codes
evidence: brands are changing to farmer codes
items.meaning: Terminology decision: 'Brand' field will be called 'Farmer Code'
items.acceptance_criteria: UI shows 'Farmer Code' instead of 'Brand'

items.title: Vendor Tied to Farmer Name
evidence: I think we can just say the vendor is the farmer's name
items.meaning: Vendor field should use farmer's name for simplicity
items.acceptance_criteria: Vendor field accepts farmer names

items.title: Vendor Search Shows Related Brands
evidence: It'll still want to type Bob. It'll pop up Bob, but it'll also they'll be Bob or Bob's buddy
I'm just trying to think of how it'd be easy like when I search my phone exactly search Evan I see all of your friends pop up because I've saved them under your name also
items.meaning: Typing vendor name shows that vendor plus all brands they've brought in
items.acceptance_criteria: Vendor search shows vendor and all associated farmer codes/brands

items.title: SKU Field Not Needed
evidence: I don't really need to see skew. I'm not sure what skew is gonna do for me
that's basically like this number over here that I've just discovered that relates to the website
items.meaning: SKU field is confusing and not useful for user, should be hidden or removed
items.acceptance_criteria: SKU field hidden from main UI or made optional/auto-generated

items.title: Customizable Product Categories
evidence: I'm gonna want to be able to just organize it by the category
Deps, Inns, Inns Candy, Sativa, Smalls
items.meaning: Product categories should be customizable (Deps, Inns, Inns Candy, Sativa, Smalls, etc.)
items.acceptance_criteria: Admin can create/edit product categories; products can be assigned to categories

items.title: Searchable Supplier Name Field
evidence: There should be a way to search or type in a supplier name
I should be able to type in that box. Because I have 100 suppliers and I can't scroll through 100 things
items.meaning: Supplier dropdown should be searchable/typeahead with 100+ suppliers
items.acceptance_criteria: Supplier field is searchable typeahead, not scroll-only dropdown

items.title: Expected Delivery Date for Intake
evidence: do you want an expected delivery date? Yeah
items.meaning: Intake should have expected delivery date field
items.acceptance_criteria: Intake form has optional expected delivery date field

items.title: Payment Terms (Consignment, Cash, COD)
evidence: COD
consignment
cash
items.meaning: Support multiple payment terms for intake
items.acceptance_criteria: Intake supports payment terms: Consignment, Cash, COD, etc.

items.title: Installment and Down Payments
evidence: installment payments
down payments
items.meaning: Support installment payments and down payments for purchases
items.acceptance_criteria: Payment can be split into installments; down payment can be recorded

items.title: Editable Product Names
evidence: editable product names
items.meaning: Product names should be editable after creation
items.acceptance_criteria: Product name can be edited after initial creation

items.title: Notes on Product Pricing
evidence: notes on product pricing
items.meaning: Ability to add notes/context to pricing decisions
items.acceptance_criteria: Product pricing has notes field for context

items.title: Quick Action Pricing Visibility
evidence: quick pricing actions
items.meaning: Quick visibility into pricing for fast decision-making
items.acceptance_criteria: Pricing visible at a glance without drilling into product details

items.title: Product Details: Name, Category, Brand (Not SKU)
evidence: The product needs to be actually not the skew, but the, uh, the straight name and, and then category and a brand
items.meaning: Product display should show: Name, Category, Brand/Farmer Code (not SKU)
items.acceptance_criteria: Product list shows Name, Category, Farmer Code; SKU hidden

items.title: VIP Debt Aging Notifications
evidence: I'm mostly excited for people like Hippo or Danny to be able to be like, your debt is aging badly
You need to bring in more money, and here are the top 20 flowers that you are most excited about are available right now
items.meaning: VIP portal should notify clients when their debt is aging and show products they want
items.acceptance_criteria: VIP portal shows: (1) Debt aging status, (2) Recommended action, (3) Available products from their wants list

items.title: VIP Portal - Credit Usage Display
evidence: What it'll show is how much of their credit is already being used
It should also probably have just a dollar amount
items.meaning: VIP portal shows credit usage percentage and dollar amount
items.acceptance_criteria: VIP portal displays: credit limit, credit used (%), credit used ($), available credit

items.title: VIP Status Based on Debt Cycling
evidence: How well are you paying your debt down?
It should be just how healthy their debt is cycling
healthy debt is cycling like every two to three weeks would be like platinum
four weeks is still gold, but as soon as they touch five, then it's like bronze
diamond is like a week
items.meaning: VIP status tiers based on debt cycling frequency: Diamond (1 week), Platinum (2-3 weeks), Gold (4 weeks), Bronze (5+ weeks)
items.acceptance_criteria: VIP status calculated from debt cycling: Diamond (<1 week), Platinum (2-3 weeks), Gold (4 weeks), Bronze (5+ weeks)

items.title: Leaderboard with Anonymized Rankings
evidence: I guess that's what I'm hoping this turns into is more of a leaderboard, but like a anonymized one
they don't see the names of whoever they're with
they'll just know what position they're in
it would be nice to have it have some very simple but smart recommendations
items.meaning: Anonymized leaderboard showing position with recommendations to climb
items.acceptance_criteria: Leaderboard shows: position, points/score, recommendations to improve ranking

items.title: Leaderboard Rewards System (Medals, Markup %)
evidence: You should have medals. We can have medals
We can also have markup percent
the number one spot gets 50 on ends. And the number of the top three spots get 50 on ends and 25 on depths
Start to gamify this a little bit
items.meaning: Leaderboard rewards: medals and tiered pricing (top 3 get better margins)
items.acceptance_criteria: Leaderboard positions unlock: medals/badges, tiered pricing discounts

items.title: Live Appointments and Scheduling
evidence: They'll also be able to see like the live appointments there
what appointments are booked or what they can book
our schedule will be in this program
I'll be able to see Z's schedule
items.meaning: VIP portal shows available appointments; internal view shows all schedules
items.acceptance_criteria: VIP portal: view/book appointments. Internal: view all schedules including Z's

items.title: Multiple Rooms for Scheduling
evidence: I'll have multiple rooms and all that kind of stuff
The multiple rooms is something that we still need to build into
items.meaning: Scheduling needs to support multiple rooms
items.acceptance_criteria: Calendar supports multiple rooms/locations for appointments

items.title: Hour Tracking (Low Priority)
evidence: it'd be nice to be able to, for people, I don't know, if people can track their hours in here, too
Two people are paid hourly. Everybody else is on salary
It's so not important
items.meaning: Hour tracking nice-to-have but low priority (only 2 hourly employees)
items.acceptance_criteria: Optional time tracking for hourly employees

items.title: Calendar Navigation Bug
evidence: when I do work on something, sometimes it bumps it off the navigation
I made a change to the calendar. And so now we can't see it on here
Oh, it moved it
items.meaning: Developer changes to calendar sometimes cause it to disappear from navigation
items.acceptance_criteria: Calendar remains visible in navigation regardless of code changes

items.title: Shift/Vacation Tracking on Calendar
evidence: It's showing who's on what shifts
Like when people just put in for vacation
It's nice to know if Momo's there or not there, and who's covering for her
items.meaning: Calendar shows shifts and vacation/time-off for staff
items.acceptance_criteria: Calendar shows: staff shifts, vacation/time-off, coverage

items.title: User Roles and Permissions
evidence: user roles, basically
you would have a photographer role. And they could only really see. Inventory
you start to give it permissions, basically
Probably it's not going to get edited much
items.meaning: Role-based permissions (e.g., photographer sees only inventory)
items.acceptance_criteria: Admin can create roles with specific permissions; users assigned to roles

items.title: VIP Portal - Purchase History
evidence: I'm hoping their VIP portal will show them all their recent purchases
They can go to their date, and they can see what they got
And how much money they owe us
items.meaning: VIP portal shows purchase history by date and total owed
items.acceptance_criteria: VIP portal shows: purchase history by date, items purchased, total owed

items.title: User-Friendly Financial Terminology
evidence: Payables, that's how much they owe. Receivables is how much you owe them
I think they'll just want a total number. Like those words are a little confusing
So how much I owe, how much you owe me
I barely know what those words know
items.meaning: Replace accounting terms with plain language: 'How much I owe' / 'How much you owe me'
items.acceptance_criteria: UI uses plain language: 'You owe us' / 'We owe you' instead of Payables/Receivables

items.title: VIP Needs/Wants Entry
evidence: Be able to add my needs
I want this
items.meaning: VIP clients can enter their needs/wants in the portal
items.acceptance_criteria: VIP portal has form to submit needs/wants

items.title: Office Needs Auto-Population
evidence: I need to always have 300 things under $100
I need to always have 300 things between six and seven
I set those, and then that's going to auto-populate my needs
it's looking at my inventory and so it sees the inventory and it's like, wow, you don't actually have those things. And then my needs pops up
items.meaning: Set inventory thresholds; system auto-generates needs when below threshold
items.acceptance_criteria: Admin sets inventory thresholds by category/price; system generates 'Office Needs' list when inventory falls below

items.title: Centralized VIP Requests Portal
evidence: Do I have one portal where I see all of the VIPs and what they're asking?
Yeah
items.meaning: Single view showing all VIP requests/needs
items.acceptance_criteria: Admin view showing all VIP needs/requests in one place

items.title: Matchmaking - Office Needs to VIP Supplies
evidence: It's a matchmaking thing
it should just always be looking at, because people always ask me, what do you need right now?
now we're talking about one of the most powerful things probably
items.meaning: System matches office needs with VIP supplies/offers
items.acceptance_criteria: System shows matches between office needs and VIP supplies

items.title: Copy-Paste Office Needs for Non-VIP
evidence: that shouldn't just be in a VIP portal
That should probably be somewhere that you can also quickly copy and paste to send people if they ask
Because not everyone is probably going to Have one of these
items.meaning: Office needs should be easily shareable with non-VIP clients
items.acceptance_criteria: Office needs list has copy/share button for sending to non-VIP clients

items.title: No AI Integration (Constraint)
evidence: Just to be clear for the recording, we're not doing AI yet
every AI that I use is constantly trying to push me to like, use AI
I want to set all the parameters
items.meaning: No AI features in current phase; user wants manual control first
items.acceptance_criteria: No AI features implemented; all logic is rule-based and user-controlled

items.title: AI Future: Suggested Purchase Quantities
evidence: it'll see my data history of what's buying and selling and be like, why the fuck aren't you buying 200 candy bars?
You sell out in five days. Buy more
Here's the optimal amount you should buy from this farmer
items.meaning: Future AI feature: suggest optimal purchase quantities based on sales history
items.acceptance_criteria: Future: AI suggests purchase quantities based on sales velocity

items.title: Suggested Purchase Price from History
evidence: Here's a suggested purchase price for this product based upon what you paid last time
I'm always getting into it with farmers
maybe they age for two months because they were $50 too high
items.meaning: Show last purchase price when buying from same farmer
items.acceptance_criteria: Intake shows last purchase price for same product/farmer combination

items.title: Last Sale Price Lookup
evidence: Suggested what that item sold for last time is always useful
So I don't have to look it up because I do that all the time
Probably just that vendor
items.meaning: Show what product sold for last time (same vendor)
items.acceptance_criteria: Product view shows last sale price for same vendor's product

items.title: Farmer Receipt History Link
evidence: it'd just be nice to almost just have a link of what I paid last time when I saw that farmer
What you paid and what you sold
pop up, you paid 775 last time. Not what we agreed to pay, but what we actually paid
items.meaning: Quick link to last receipt/transaction with farmer
items.acceptance_criteria: Farmer view has link to last receipt showing actual paid price and sale price

items.title: Intake Receipt Tool
evidence: we still need the receipt tool to save and send to the person every time
someone can see what they brought in, I can send it to them and they can look at the shelf and be like, yes, that is indeed what I'm dropping off
items.meaning: Generate and send receipt to farmer during intake for verification
items.acceptance_criteria: Intake generates receipt that can be sent to farmer for verification

items.title: Intake Verification Process (Off by 12 Pounds Issue)
evidence: we've made several mistakes where I type up the receipt, but maybe the count is off
we've been off by 12 pounds
the person stacking the weed is not talking
We're not ticking it up
items.meaning: Need verification step where person putting away confirms quantities
items.acceptance_criteria: Intake flow has verification step: (1) Create receipt, (2) Person putting away confirms counts, (3) Finalize

items.title: Intake Flow Terminology
evidence: you need a process of doing the purchase order, which we can call something. What would you like to call that? Intake
Intake and then intake receipt basically
items.meaning: Terminology: 'Intake' for purchase order process, 'Intake Receipt' for the receipt
items.acceptance_criteria: UI uses 'Intake' and 'Intake Receipt' terminology

items.title: Storage Strategy - Zones (A, B, C, D)
evidence: Trash bags work better because you don't have to unpack them again
I think it might be useful to be like, it's going to be in zone A, B, C, or D
things don't leave zones
Zones, but rack, shelf, bin, not important right now
items.meaning: Storage by zones (A, B, C, D) sufficient; no need for rack/shelf/bin detail
items.acceptance_criteria: Product can be assigned to zone (A, B, C, D); no rack/shelf/bin required

items.title: Three Storage Sites
evidence: I think there'll be three sites
There'll be samples, there'll be storage, and there'll be shipping
Deep storage
items.meaning: Three storage sites: Samples, Storage (deep storage), Shipping
items.acceptance_criteria: Product can be assigned to site: Samples, Storage, Shipping

items.title: Category and Subcategory Data Flow
evidence: it's basically category and subcategory, which, by the way, just for the recording, you need to flow through correctly to the rest of this
items.meaning: Category/subcategory must flow correctly through all parts of system
items.acceptance_criteria: Category and subcategory data propagates correctly to all views and reports

items.title: Product Grades (AAA, AAAA, AA, B, C)
evidence: It just needs to be double, triple, and quad
Triple A, quad A, double A, and then there's B and C
you can kind of forget about everything else
items.meaning: Product grades: AAAA (Quad A), AAA (Triple A), AA (Double A), B, C
items.acceptance_criteria: Product has grade field with options: AAAA, AAA, AA, B, C

items.title: VIP Client Management
evidence: This is just where you're going to be able to manage all the VIP clients, create them
items.meaning: Admin interface to manage and create VIP clients
items.acceptance_criteria: Admin can create, edit, and manage VIP client accounts

items.title: Notification System for Tagging
evidence: Do you want this concept of the notification where if you tag Tigger on something, it pops up somewhere?
items.meaning: Notification system when users are tagged
items.acceptance_criteria: Users receive notifications when tagged; notifications appear in dedicated area

items.title: Large Distributor Pricing (Future)
evidence: If we sell this to like large distributors, you should charge them
items.meaning: Future consideration: pricing model for large distributors
items.acceptance_criteria: Future: define pricing for large distributor customers

items.title: Modular Sales Options (Future)
evidence: I feel like you might also be able to sell little modules of it
Like most people probably don't need most of this
items.meaning: Future consideration: sell system as modular components
items.acceptance_criteria: Future: modular product packaging strategy

items.title: Live Shopping Feature
evidence: But you could also do some things like the live shopping or whatever
I think that could actually really add value
Live shopping is someone that has the app? No, that's somebody like sitting in your...
items.meaning: Live shopping = in-person shopping experience (not e-commerce)
items.acceptance_criteria: System optimized for in-person live shopping workflow

decisions.statement: Brands are changing to Farmer Codes
decisions.rationale: Better alignment with data structure and user mental model

decisions.statement: Vendor will be tied to the farmer's name
SKU field not needed, should be hidden
decisions.rationale: User doesn't understand what SKU does for them
Allows users to organize products according to their needs

decisions.statement: Start to gamify the leaderboard with rewards
No AI integration at this stage
decisions.rationale: User wants manual control first; AI keeps being pushed inappropriately
Only 2 people paid hourly, rest on salary
Items move around too much for precise location tracking
User's preferred terminology for purchase order process

decisions.statement: New clients added 2-3 times per year
decisions.rationale: Low frequency means client creation doesn't need to be fast

risks.trigger: Manual data entry errors across multiple areas (money in, expenses, payments)
risks.impact: Weekly audit failures, time wasted reconciling
risks.mitigation: Implement simple in/out ledger with weekly reset; reduce copy/paste operations

risks.trigger: Person typing receipt not communicating with person stacking product
risks.mitigation: Add verification step where person putting away confirms quantities
Use user-friendly language ('what I owe' / 'what you owe me')

risks.statement: Multiple error points in current spreadsheet workflow
risks.mitigation: Consolidate into single system with automated calculations
Suggested pricing based on history; aging visual indicators

risks.trigger: Clients who are both buyers and suppliers (like Jesse)
risks.mitigation: Unified ledger view showing all credits and debits

followup_questions.question: What are the exact thresholds for VIP status tiers (Diamond, Platinum, Gold, Bronze)?
followup_questions.context: User mentioned rough thresholds but exact cutoffs need confirmation
followup_questions.answer: Make it customizable - allow tiers to be set based on either comparison to other customers (relative ranking) OR specific numbers/figures (absolute thresholds). Admin should be able to configure either approach.

followup_questions.question: How many rooms will the scheduling system need to support?
followup_questions.context: Multiple rooms mentioned but count not specified
followup_questions.answer: 2 meeting rooms and 2 loading bays (4 schedulable spaces total).

followup_questions.question: What are the exact markup percentages for each leaderboard tier?
followup_questions.context: User mentioned $50 on ends, $25 on deps for top 3, but full tier structure unclear
followup_questions.answer: This is a reward system tied to specific tiers. Make it customizable so admin can define the markup/discount percentages for each tier.

followup_questions.question: Should the receipt tool integrate with the website or be standalone?
followup_questions.context: Receipt tool mentioned but integration points unclear
followup_questions.answer: Keep as is in the product (standalone, no additional integration needed).

followup_questions.question: What payment processing companies are used and what are their fee structures?
followup_questions.context: Fees vary 2-4% but specific providers not mentioned
followup_questions.answer: Save transport company fee and payment split settings per client so users don't have to set it up every time. Also allow adding and using different providers, then editing them as needed.

followup_questions.question: What is the desired behavior when inventory thresholds are breached?
followup_questions.context: Auto-populate needs, but should there be notifications?
followup_questions.answer: Use best decision (auto-populate needs when thresholds are breached) but make the behavior customizable so admin can configure notification preferences and threshold actions.

followup_questions.question: How should the system handle partial payments on installment plans?
followup_questions.context: Installments mentioned but tracking details unclear
followup_questions.answer: RECOMMENDATION (based on industry best practices): Use FIFO (First-In-First-Out) allocation where payments are applied to the oldest due installment first. Implementation: (1) When creating intake with installment terms, system generates payment schedule with total amount, number of installments, and frequency. (2) Each partial payment is recorded with date, amount, method, and notes. (3) System auto-updates remaining balance and next due date. (4) Visual status indicators: On Track (green), Overdue (red), Paid in Full (blue). (5) Allow manual adjustments, skip/reschedule options, and early payoff. (6) All installment payments flow into the unified client ledger with clear distinction from other transactions.

followup_questions.question: What is the desired notification mechanism for VIP clients?
followup_questions.context: User said 'I can't imagine there'll be an app that'll ding' - what's the alternative?
followup_questions.answer: Show a notification or new message alert when the VIP user logs in to the portal. No push notifications or external app alerts needed.

followup_questions.question: Should the referrer lookup show only direct referrals or the full referral chain?
followup_questions.context: Phone contact analogy suggests direct only, but could be multi-level
followup_questions.answer: Direct referrals only. When searching for a client, show that client plus all clients they directly referred (like phone contacts). No need for multi-level referral chains.

followup_questions.question: What is the process for handling disputed intake quantities?
followup_questions.context: Verification step added but dispute resolution unclear
followup_questions.answer: RECOMMENDATION: Implement a 3-step dispute resolution process: (1) FLAGGING: Person putting away inventory can flag a discrepancy with the original receipt, noting the difference (e.g., 'Receipt says 12 lbs, actual count is 10 lbs'). (2) REVIEW: Flag triggers a notification to admin/manager who reviews the discrepancy with both parties (receipt creator and verifier). (3) RESOLUTION: Admin can either (a) Adjust the receipt to match actual count with audit note, or (b) Confirm original receipt if error was in verification. All changes are logged with timestamp, user, and reason for audit trail. This prevents the '12 pounds off' scenario by catching discrepancies before they become disputes.
